#Text=Activate Verizon Internet
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to activate
#Text=Verizon internet services .
#Text=When you sign up for Verizon internet services , they send you a welcome letter or email , and an installation package .
#Text=The welcome letter contains your Service Ready Date ( SRD ) , and your order number .
#Text=You can activate your services at anytime after your Service Ready Date .
#Text=You should always activate your internet before activating any additional services you ordered through Verizon .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Connect a Coaxial cable from an outlet to the router .
#Text=Find a location near a coaxial wall outlet .
#Text=Connect a coaxial cable from the wall outlet to the coaxial input on the back of the router that came with your installation package .
#Text=If you ordered internet speeds of 100 mbps or higher , you will also need to connect an ethernet cable from an ethernet outlet to the WAN port on the back of your router .

#Text=If you do n't have a coaxial wall outlet , use the barrel connector that came with the package to connect the coaxial cable connected to the router to the coaxial cable that carries services to your home .
#Text=Plug the router into an electrical outlet and power it on .
#Text=Connect the AC adapter that came with the router the the AC in port on the back of the router .
#Text=Plug the router into an electrical outlet .
#Text=Allow up to 15 minutes for the router to activate .
#Text=It will power on and off during this process .
#Text=When the lights on the front are solid white , and the lights on the back are solid green , the router is ready .
#Text=Different routers may have a slightly different setup process .
#Text=Connect your computer to the router using an ethernet cable .
#Text=A wired connection will provide the most reliable connection .

#Text=To connect your computer to your router using a wired connection , connect an ethernet cable to an ethernet port on your computer and then connect it to one of the four yellow ethernet ports on the back of the router .
#Text=Locate the wireless information on the router .
#Text=There is a label on the router that contains both the wireless network name and password .
#Text=It 's most likely located on the side of the router .
#Text=This is label contains the information you need to connect to your router using a wireless connection .
#Text=Connect your wireless devices .
#Text=To connect to the internet using a wireless connection , select the wireless connection listed on the router 's label from the list of available networks .
#Text=Enter the password on the router 's label when prompted .
#Text=The password is case sensitive .
#Text=Read " 4 Ways to Connect to a Wireless Internet Connection " to learn more about how to connect to a wireless connection using different devices .
#Text=Some routers offer a 2.4 ghz internet connection , and a 5 ghz internet connection .
#Text=2.4 ghz is a slower connection , but offers greater range .
#Text=5 ghz is faster and more suitable for video streaming and gaming .
#Text=Go to https://activate.verizon.com in a web browser .
#Text=You can use any web browser on your PC , Mac , or mobile device .
#Text=Log in to the Verizon activation page .
#Text=If you already have a Verizon account , click or tap User ID and Password to log in with your user ID or email , and password .
#Text=Follow the instructions to finish the activation process .
#Text=If you do not yet have a Verizon account , click or tap Order number and ZIP code .
#Text=The order number is included in the confirmation email or letter that was sent to your from Verizon .
#Text=Enter the green portion of the order number as displayed on the website .
#Text=Follow the instructions to set up a Verizon account and complete your activation .
#Text=Quick Summary
